item.description:
He will also speak about:

* The myths and facts about how to select and enjoy fish

* The story about Maguro(tuna) around the world:

   How to tell real tuna and the areas it comes from

* Fish and its relation between the moon and tides

* Fish cooking hints and secrets

* Information about seafood export/import business

 

Guests: $20  JREX members: $10

Price includes: Toro sashimi, home cooked Japanese dishes, and drinks, including alcohol.

Please register by March 17 online at www.jrex.us

This is a 21+ event

Nearest Station: Lechmere - Green line

Public Parking: Behind Lechmere Station ($5.50/day), 2 minutes walk to Archstone.

Archstone building is in between Lechmere Station and the Science Museum, and it's diagonally accross from the Science Museum.

Ask for the function room at the desk.

 

It's a bilingual event, and you'll meet Japanese and Americans to mingle over drinks and Japanese dishes in a relaxed atmosphere.  Anybody is wellcome!

Hope to see you there!
item.why: Yoshi - the former owner of Cherry Mart on Newbury St. opened a fish shop in Allston. His mission is to introduce uncommon fish to the world. You will get to try two kinds of high quality fatty tuna sashimi, and he will tell you how to enjoy them.
item.name: JREX Mingling Event! Fish Fish Fish!!!
